Descripción de la empresaSGS es una compañía multinacional de origen suizo, líder mundial en servicios de inspección, verificación, análisis y certificación de productos y servicios, con más de 2600 oficinas y laboratorios a nivel mundial. En el Perú, operamos en la mayoría de los sectores económicos como minería, agricultura y pesca formando parte de la cadena de valor de sus productos y servicios.Descripción del empleoAsesorar, analizar y ejecutar los requerimientos de información a nivel funcional, mediante la búsqueda de nuevas tecnologías y sus beneficios para contar con información que permita la toma de decisiones basada en hechos (insights) e impulsar la monetización de los datos haciendo uso de frameworks de Data Managements.Identificar la data necesaria para producir los insights adecuados para el cliente interno/externo. Asesorar a los líderes de las unidades de negocio sintetizando las ideas complejas derivadas de análisis en recomendaciones fáciles de entender y accionables para su ejecución.Recabar las necesidades de información del cliente interno/externo a fin de evaluar la viabilidad de su implantación.Asesorar, facilitar a los SMs y POs de los diferentes Squads con respecto de las soluciones basadas en Data a nivel funcional. Ejecutar los planes de trabajo/sprints hacia su cumplimiento en los squads que se le asigne.Participar activamente de los Squads definidos con las áreas de negocio hacia la definición de necesidades y atención de estas. Garantizar que la solución analítica resuelva el problema empresarial de la forma más eficiente e interpretable para los usuarios de negocio.Analizar procesos internos de cada área de negocio con la finalidad de proponer indicadores/mejoras de gestión del dato acorde a sus metas.Definir inicialmente los reportes/dashboards en las cuales se visualizará/ppresentará la información solicitada por los clientes internos y externos.Analizar las necesidades de SandBox (espacios de investigación y exploración de información) de áreas usuarias (Power Users) hacia su definición, implantación y control, con vías a su oficialización en ambientes productivos.Investigar nuevos métodos/tecnologías de analítica, AI y ML existentes en el mercado para su propuesta de uso en la organización y generar valor.Promover una cultura de gobierno de información en la organización.Diseñar e implantar soluciones en base a las mejores prácticas y estándares de gestión de información e inteligencia de negocios, así como de mejora de procesos.Propiciar iniciativas de Data Quality en función de observaciones y/o problemáticas encontradas durante la atención de necesidades de información. Propiciar comunicación y coordinación directa con los COEs globales y regionales respecto de las soluciones a proponer e implementar, en coordinación con los expertos técnicos de TI a nivel funcional.Propiciar acciones y lineamientos de data governance hacia la monetización y socialización de los datos.RequisitosProfesionales de las carreras de Gestión de Información, Ing. Informática y de Sistemas, Investigación Operativa, Estadística o afines.Experiencia mínima de 4 años en área de gestión de información/datos y 3 años ejecutando proyectos u opertiva de data y en proyecto de implementación tecnológica en roles técnicos o analíticos.Experiencia mínima de 5 años como analista funcional y/o 2 años como data science.Experiencia mínima de 2 años trabajando con metodologías ágiles.Experiencia en manejo de Datalake, Lakes con diferentes tecnologías.Experiencia con tecnologías de bases de datos, framewoks de trabajo DataOps, Data Quality y Data Management. Experiencia en procesamiento de información de diversas fuentes y desarrollos ETL Experiencia en implementación de Datawarehouse, LakeHouse.Experiencia en proyectos de Data Quality y Data Governance.Deseable conocimiento en destión de proyectos, Analytics, Big Data, AI, ML, Transformación Digital e Innovación abierta.Información adicionalIngreso a planilla desde el primer día.Seguro de Vida Ley.Prima EPS cubierto al 80% Capacitaciones constantes.Convenios Corporativos.

Resumen del trabajo:El/La Consultor(a) de Análisis y Visualización de Datos brindará apoyo al equipo de Monitoreo, Evaluación y Conocimiento (MEC) en MOCCA para diseñar y/o ajustar dashboards para visualizar datos e indicadores clave del proyecto en el sistema de información de MOCCA. El Sistema de información de MOCCA está construido en MySQL y se utiliza PowerBi para visualizar la información. Las actividades principales incluyen: realizar limpieza y análisis de información, elaborar y/o ajustar dashboards que permitan visualizar la información de forma clara y amigable para todos los usuarios del sistema.Funciones y responsabilidades principales:Realizar limpiezas de información y análisis de datosRevisar los dashboards actuales del sistema y proponer ajustes que permitan visualizar la información de forma clara y sencilla a los equiposElaborar nuevos dashboards con Power Bi, tomando como base la información almacenada en el sistema de información de MOCCARealizar cualquier otra actividad afín al puesto.Cualificaciones básicas:Título universitario en Ciencia de los Datos, Estadística, Ingeniería o similar más 3 años de experiencia en trabajos similares; o título superior más 5 años de experiencia en trabajos similares.Experto en el uso de ExcelHabilidades avanzadas en la visualización de datos utilizando software PowerBI. Es preferible tener experiencia en lenguaje de programaciónExperiencia en el desarrollo de mensajes claros a partir de bases de datos complejas y en crear una narración eficaz mediante visualizaciones de datos claras y sencillas, que sean fáciles de comprender para diferentes tipos de audiencias.Cualificaciones deseadas: Experiencia en el análisis estadístico avanzado con conocimientos de un paquete estadístico como SPSS, STATA o R será un plusExperiencia analizando datos de monitoreo y evaluación en el contexto del desarrollo internacional.Idiomas Requeridos: Español e InglésViajes: No aplicaConocimientos, Habilidades y Destrezas:Es fundamental contar con una gran capacidad de comunicación. Se necesita una capacidad de escucha eficaz para comprender el contexto y diseñar dashboards o realizar análisis que respondan a las ideas necesarias.Capacidad para trabajar de forma independiente y a distancia, contribuyendo al mismo tiempo a un esfuerzo de equipo.Una disposición amigable y respetuosa con excelentes habilidades de comunicación interpersonal.Buena capacidad de redacción.Excelentes referencias personales y laborales.

En DHL Express, nuestro propósito es “Conectar a las personas, mejorar vidas”. Somos la empresa más internacional del mundo, "la gran máquina amarilla", como nos encanta llamarla. Específicamente en nuestra región de América Central y del Sur, cubrimos 15 países, desde el Parque Nacional Tikal en Guatemala, hasta Ushuaia en Tierra del Fuego - Argentina. The Data Science team is foundational for building the next generation of OfferUp and helping our customers connect with the deals and items they are looking for quickly and without friction. advance in their careersChampion operational excellence, establishing metrics and process for regular assessment and improvement of models and solutions which are tightly aligned with rest of the excellenceOperate strategically and tacticallyExceptional written and verbal communicationCollaborate with Product and Engineering leaders to scope, identify, and refine data science requests developmentExpertise in querying and retrieving data using SQL from large data systemsPh.D. or Master’s Degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics or a related technical field OR Bachelor’s degree and relevant work experienceExpertise in classical NLP methods (POS tagging, NER, n-grams, keyword extraction) as well as deep learning methods (semantic analysis, RNNs, LSTMs/GRUs, model training desired, deeper knowledge preferredActively coached and mentored team members in their careersBeen actively involved in building vision, strategy, and roadmapsShipped several large OfferUpOfferUp is dedicated to changing the way people buy and sell in their communities. As the largest mobile marketplace for local buyers and sellers in the U.S., the company offers iOS and Android apps that make selling an item as easy as snapping a picture from your mobile device. Founded in April 2011, OfferUp is reinventing local commerce by helping consumers uncover value through simplicity and trust. In 2020, OfferUp combined with letgo to reach more than 20M monthly users.More About OfferUp At a Glance#2 U.S. shopping app in Q1 of ‘21, Top 5 in App Store and Google Play Store for three years.100M+ Downloads, 20M+ monthly users56M People used OfferUp last year (1 in 4 people over the age of 14)OfferUp works directly with nearly 2,000 US law enforcement agencies to build trust in local communities by creating safe in-person locations for OfferUp transactions.Billions of dollars worth of transactions are facilitated via the OfferUp marketplace every monthOfferUp is changing the way people buy and sell locally, and we’ve built a dynamic team to do it. To learn more about what it’s like to work at OfferUp, check out our blog: https://blog.offerup.comOfferUp provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, OfferUp complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training.OfferUp expressly prohibits any form of workplace harassment based on race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, genetic information, disability, or veteran status. Improper interference with the ability of OfferUp’s employees to perform their job duties may result in discipline up to and including discharge.

ObjetivoResponsable de la supervisión del estado de producción de bases de datos Institucional (público y privado) y ejecutar las acciones adecuadas para garantizar que estas bases se entreguen a tiempo. Escalar donde se requiera la acción correctiva, incluida la priorización de la carga de trabajo del procesamiento de datos, la comunicación y coordinación con otros equipos operativos y de usuarios, y escalar el problema a través de proceso de gestión de problemas. Informa el estado de procesos de forma diaria, semanal y mensual. Actualiza los procedimientos operativos estándar (SOP) según sea necesario. Recepción, carga y preprocesamiento de base de datos para extracción de bases. Realiza control de calidad a la referenciación de datos de Productos (Institucionales) y Clientes asociados a los datos recepcionados. Participa también en la referenciación de datos cuando sea necesario. Responsable de la revisión de alertas en tendencia de ventas por Productos, Territorios y Clientes. Generación de reportes para el área comercial. Automatización de procesos.Requisitos Egresado de las carreras de Ingeniería industrial, Ingeniería de sistemas o carreras afines. Tres (3) años de experiencia previa en operaciones de producción de datos/manejo bases de datos. Amplio conocimiento de los paquetes de software de programación como SQL Server Management Studio, SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS). Amplio conocimiento y manejo del paquete Microsoft Office. Capacidad para navegar por los entornos de producción y Windows. Comprensión completa de los requisitos del entorno de producción de datos. Conocimiento de productos asociados a ventas institucionales (Deseable). Inglés intermedio (Deseable).IQVIA is a leading global provider of advanced analytics, technology solutions and clinical research services to the life sciences industry. ¡Únete a la familia Scharff!Esta es tu oportunidad para formar parte de una gran empresa, que tiene más de 30 años creando conexiones de alto valor en la cadena logística. Desarrollar procesos de integración de datos desde diversas fuentes de información, a través de las herramientas y tecnologías adoptadas por Scharff. Aplicar métodos de vanguardia en la entrega de fuentes de datos, con orientación al usuario técnico, interno, de Scharff. Monitorear impacto, usabilidad, aplicabilidad, y satisfacción de los usuarios o analistas para cada estructura o pipeline de datos entregado.¿CÓMO POSTULAR?A través del siguiente link:https://forms.gle/PiUytkg38nvrTLCJ9 ¿QUÉ TE OFRECEMOS?• Sueldo acorde al mercado• Beneficios Corporativos• Trabajo híbrido• EPS• Un excelente clima laboral donde podrás desarrollar tu potencial• Línea de carrera

OfferUp  is looking for an experienced Lead Applied Data Scientist to help build data science and machine learning solutions while helping to lead and build our Data Science and ML team. The Data Science team is foundational for building the next generation of OfferUp and helping our customers connect with the deals and items they are looking for quickly and without friction. As a Senior Data Scientist, you will partner with all product areas, adding insights and intelligence to support Personalization, Trust & Safety, and Search & Discovery.As an engineering leader you will direct and influence technology and design decisions, and partner with our product leaders on building and delivering on the Data & Personalization roadmap.This role is only available outside the US and not available to any individual based within the US or any US territory.Responsibilities Lead a team of Data/Applied Scientists in achieving state of the art applied machine learning solutions.  Own, oversee, and delegate the design, architecture, development, testing, deployment, and delivery of large-scale NLP, CV, and classical machine learning solutions capable of making real time and batch decisions. Examples include Multi-class Classification of text and images, specialized text extraction, semantic understanding, improved search and retrieval, etc.  Develop members on the team, helping them advance in their careers  Champion operational excellence, establishing metrics and process for regular assessment and improvement of models and solutions which are tightly aligned with rest of the engineering systems  Keep the team up to-date with latest applied research solutions in NLP and CV  Establish standards of model updates, detecting model drift and performance and setting up benchmarks of excellence  Operate strategically and tactically  Exceptional written and verbal communication  Collaborate with Product and Engineering leaders to scope, identify, and refine data science requests Requirements 7+ years of building and shipping ML models and data solutions with quality  5+ years of professional software development in languages such as Python, Java  Experience and API development  Expertise in querying and retrieving data using SQL from large data systems  Ph.D. or Master’s Degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics or a related technical field OR Bachelor’s degree and relevant work experience  Expertise in classical NLP methods (POS tagging, NER, n-grams, keyword extraction) as well as deep learning methods (semantic analysis, RNNs, LSTMs/GRUs, transformers)  Knowledge of large language models (BERT family) and their applications preferred  Working knowledge of deep learning methods applied to images highly preferred (CNNs, Transfer Learning)  Expertise in open source deep learning frameworks (Tensorflow/Keras)  Experience in creating microservices and deployment on cloud infrastructure (AWS, Azure, GCP)  Experience in using GPUs for model training desired, deeper knowledge preferred  Actively coached and mentored team members in their careers  Been actively involved in building vision, strategy, and roadmaps  Shipped several large scale projects with multiple dependencies across teams  Ability to communicate across teams and levels  Excellent communication skills both written and spoken (fluency in English required) About OfferUpOfferUp is dedicated to changing the way people buy and sell in their communities. As the largest mobile marketplace for local buyers and sellers in the U.S., the company offers iOS and Android apps that make selling an item as easy as snapping a picture from your mobile device. Founded in April 2011, OfferUp is reinventing local commerce by helping consumers uncover value through simplicity and trust. In 2020, OfferUp combined with letgo to reach more than 20M monthly users.More About OfferUp At a Glance#2 U.S. shopping app in Q1 of ‘21, Top 5 in App Store and Google Play Store for three years.100M+ Downloads, 20M+ monthly users56M People used OfferUp last year (1 in 4 people over the age of 14)OfferUp works directly with nearly 2,000 US law enforcement agencies to build trust in local communities by creating safe in-person locations for OfferUp transactions.Billions of dollars worth of transactions are facilitated via the OfferUp marketplace every monthOfferUp is changing the way people buy and sell locally, and we’ve built a dynamic team to do it. To learn more about what it’s like to work at OfferUp, check out our blog: https://blog.offerup.comOfferUp provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, OfferUp complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training.OfferUp expressly prohibits any form of workplace harassment based on race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, genetic information, disability, or veteran status. Improper interference with the ability of OfferUp’s employees to perform their job duties may result in discipline up to and including discharge.

IPA Peru has been leading field-based randomized evaluations since 2003. Our work in Peru and the region is defined by strong engagement with key decision-makers and foundational research in: education, gender-based violence, social protection, financial inclusion, and health.IPA Peru seeks a Research Associate (RA) to lead and manage the Endline stage of an RCT in Belize, for a period of 6 months. The RA will provide technical support, lead data collection and analysis in a Educational project. The RA will work closely with the Associate Research Manager and other project partners. This dynamic role provides a unique opportunity to get exposure to all aspects of mission-driven international research and provides a high potential for growth within the team. If you are interested in the international development and/or evidence space across programs, this role maybe just right for you. We are looking for people who share our passion for data-driven approach to identifying, scaling, and continuously improving programs. IPA is seeking a highly motivated and qualified individual with outstanding research, project management, and data analysis expertise.ResponsibilitiesBelow is a list of some of the general duties and responsibilities of the Research Associate, to be carried out as needed according to the determination of the Associate Research Manager.Project preparation and planning, including piloting and scoping work or secondary research to contribute to the research instruments and fieldwork protocolsManage relationships with staff at the partner organization, including regular follow-ups and meetingsEnsuring all data quality protocols are followed including auditing staff and performing regular data checks on collected dataManage all data security aspects of the project, including protection of PII from un-authorized access and useProgram forms for electronic data collection (using Survey CTO) and manage survey dataEnsure all aspects of data quality by overseeing the implementation of data quality protocols including daily quality checks and data security and sharing.Take a lead on data cleaning, preliminary analysis (as directed by the PI and ARM) as well as other data processes on the projectWriting regular progress reports and leading project meetings to ensure deadlines are metWork closely with the Associate Research Manager and Grants team in managing donor deliverablesManage project staff hiring; prepare project staff hiring adverts, work with the HR department on screening and assist in conducting project interviewsMaintain regular communication with the Principal Investigators, keeping them updated on the progressMaintain and constantly update the project log and other documentations -Overall finance oversight on the project including financial tracking, reporting and budget managementQualificationsEducation: Bachelor’s degree in economics, statistics, public policy, or other quantitative social science disciplinesQuantitative Skills: Strong technical understanding of econometrics and / or data science strongly preferredDemonstrated proficiency in the use of statistical software such as Stata or R, and experience with data management and data cleaningA minimum of 2 years of work experience is required.Experience managing field staff, partner liaison and relationship management in developing countries strongly preferredExcellent management and organizational skills; ability to successfully complete assigned tasks and meet deadlines requiredAttention to detail and advanced writing and presentation skills are requiredCommunication Skills: strong oral and written communication skills in the English language requiredApplication InstructionsApply nowAbout IPAInnovations for Poverty Action (IPA) is a research and policy nonprofit that discovers and promotes effective solutions to global poverty problems. IPA brings together researchers and decision-makers to design, rigorously evaluate, and refine these solutions and their applications, ensuring that the evidence created is used to improve the lives of the world’s poor. In recent decades, trillions of dollars have been spent on programs designed to reduce global poverty, but clear evidence on which programs succeed is rare, and when evidence does exist, decision-makers often do not know about it. IPA exists to bring together leading researchers and these decision-makers to ensure that the evidence we create leads to tangible impact on the world. Since its founding in 2002, IPA has worked with over 600 leading academics to conduct over 900 evaluations in 52 countries. This research has informed hundreds of successful programs that now impact millions of individuals worldwide.IPA's Commitment to Diversity, Equity, & Inclusion (DEI)As an organization, IPA is dedicated to improving the lives of the world's most vulnerable populations through evidence and policy. We also recognize how important it is for our staff to reflect the diversity of the places where we work and the communities we work with. As such, IPA is committed to hiring from a diverse pool of candidates, from a range of backgrounds, beliefs, experiences, and perspectives. We know that this makes our work stronger and more responsive to the challenges faced by those we work with and for and we encourage people from historically underrepresented groups to apply. Click here to learn more about IPA’s commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion.Innovations for Poverty Action is an affirmative action equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other protected class. IPA will endeavor to make a reasonable accommodation to a qualified applicant with a disability unless the accommodation would impose an undue hardship on the operation of our business. If you believe you require such assistance to complete this form or to participate in an interview, please contact us at jobs@poverty-action.org or via phone at 1-202-386-6200. The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of the work to be performed by the specified position. The statements are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all possible duties, tasks, and responsibilities. Management reserves the right to amend and change responsibilities to meet organizational needs as necessary. Please note that IPA will never request any form of payment from an applicant. Un grupo con más de 3.000 consultores.La persona seleccionada deberá cambiar su residencia a España en pocas semanas. Si tuvieras la nacionalidad de alguno de los países de la Unión Europa será todo más sencillo y rápido.Requisitos. Conocimiento y Experiencia RequeridaExperiencia en Automatización de procesos repetitivos mediante programación. Ingles: Avanzado. Python Avanzado: Obligatorio. OfferUp  is looking for an experienced Lead Applied Data Scientist to help build data science and machine learning solutions while helping to lead and build our Data Science and ML team. The Data Science team is foundational for building the next generation of OfferUp and helping our customers connect with the deals and items they are looking for quickly and without friction. As a Senior Data Scientist, you will partner with all product areas, adding insights and intelligence to support Personalization, Trust & Safety, and Search & Discovery.As an engineering leader you will direct and influence technology and design decisions, and partner with our product leaders on building and delivering on the Data & Personalization roadmap.This role is only available outside the US and not available to any individual based within the US or any US territory.Responsibilities Lead a team of Data/Applied Scientists in achieving state of the art applied machine learning solutions.  Own, oversee, and delegate the design, architecture, development, testing, deployment, and delivery of large-scale NLP, CV, and classical machine learning solutions capable of making real time and batch decisions. Examples include Multi-class Classification of text and images, specialized text extraction, semantic understanding, improved search and retrieval, etc.  Develop members on the team, helping them advance in their careers  Champion operational excellence, establishing metrics and process for regular assessment and improvement of models and solutions which are tightly aligned with rest of the engineering systems  Keep the team up to-date with latest applied research solutions in NLP and CV  Establish standards of model updates, detecting model drift and performance and setting up benchmarks of excellence  Operate strategically and tactically  Exceptional written and verbal communication  Collaborate with Product and Engineering leaders to scope, identify, and refine data science requests Requirements 7+ years of building and shipping ML models and data solutions with quality  5+ years of professional software development in languages such as Python, Java  Experience and API development  Expertise in querying and retrieving data using SQL from large data systems  Ph.D. or Master’s Degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics or a related technical field OR Bachelor’s degree and relevant work experience  Expertise in classical NLP methods (POS tagging, NER, n-grams, keyword extraction) as well as deep learning methods (semantic analysis, RNNs, LSTMs/GRUs, transformers)  Knowledge of large language models (BERT family) and their applications preferred  Working knowledge of deep learning methods applied to images highly preferred (CNNs, Transfer Learning)  Expertise in open source deep learning frameworks (Tensorflow/Keras)  Experience in creating microservices and deployment on cloud infrastructure (AWS, Azure, GCP)  Experience in using GPUs for model training desired, deeper knowledge preferred  Actively coached and mentored team members in their careers  Been actively involved in building vision, strategy, and roadmaps  Shipped several large scale projects with multiple dependencies across teams  Ability to communicate across teams and levels  Excellent communication skills both written and spoken (fluency in English required) About OfferUpOfferUp is dedicated to changing the way people buy and sell in their communities. As the largest mobile marketplace for local buyers and sellers in the U.S., the company offers iOS and Android apps that make selling an item as easy as snapping a picture from your mobile device. Founded in April 2011, OfferUp is reinventing local commerce by helping consumers uncover value through simplicity and trust. In 2020, OfferUp combined with letgo to reach more than 20M monthly users.More About OfferUp At a Glance#2 U.S. shopping app in Q1 of ‘21, Top 5 in App Store and Google Play Store for three years.100M+ Downloads, 20M+ monthly users56M People used OfferUp last year (1 in 4 people over the age of 14)OfferUp works directly with nearly 2,000 US law enforcement agencies to build trust in local communities by creating safe in-person locations for OfferUp transactions.Billions of dollars worth of transactions are facilitated via the OfferUp marketplace every monthOfferUp is changing the way people buy and sell locally, and we’ve built a dynamic team to do it. To learn more about what it’s like to work at OfferUp, check out our blog: https://blog.offerup.comOfferUp provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, OfferUp complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training.OfferUp expressly prohibits any form of workplace harassment based on race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, genetic information, disability, or veteran status. Improper interference with the ability of OfferUp’s employees to perform their job duties may result in discipline up to and including discharge.

Press Tab to Move to Skip to Content LinkJoin Oterra in making natural food and beverages easy, for a sustainable and healthy world.Headquartered in Denmark, with production sites in Europe, Latin America, and the US, we’re a passionate team of over 900 team members in 30 countries worldwide, serving 120 markets globally. As the leading worldwide provider of natural colors, we offer food and beverage manufacturers an alternative to artificial colors. Food and health are at the heart of everything we do and every day over 400 million people eat a product with our colors in it. We believe that nature got it right the first time.Meet your new team!We are looking for a talented Master Data Specialist based in our office in either Valinhos, Brazil or Lima, Peru, joining our Global Master Data team, today present in Denmark and Poland. The team is responsible for creation and maintenance of global master data for all geographies. The ideal candidate is passionate, committed, and proactive and have the interest in building and maintaining a solid master data platform. You are structured and have an analytical mindset and takes pride in your detail orientation. We expect you to be open, service minded and invite to cooperation. You have the ability to work independently and as part of a team. The nature of our business is fast moving, why it is also important that you enjoy working in a dynamic and changing environment. You are fluent in English, as you will be working with colleagues globally. Finally, you thrive with repetitive operational tasks.What will your day-to-day look like?As a Master Data Specialist your main responsibilities will include:Create and maintain master data in SAP S/4HANA (Customer, vendors, materials etc.)Conduct data cleansing to inactivate/delete old, unused or duplicate dataSupport business with data extracts, mass loads etc.Ensure that global rules are established and enforcedSupport process improvement within, but not limited to, above mentioned areasExperience And Skills RequiredDegree in Engineering, Supply chain management, IT or data management2+ years of experience with master data management and data analyticsExperience with SAP ECC or S/4HANA is a requirementStrong skills in Excel and BI toolsExperience with MS Power Automate is an advantage but not a requirementWell organized and able to work with and meet deadlinesWe can offer an exciting opportunity in an ambitious organization, where commitment is strong, and where we work with the purpose to improve our processes and results. The Sr. Analytics Engineer will help our communities thrive by building and maintaining data assets to empower our business to gain insights with self-serve analytics. We are a culture that is unabashedly driven by purpose. We are making a difference to our patients and providers while growing at an accelerated rate.  Every day, we support the health journey of patients by authentically living our core values: Purpose Driven, Relationships Matter, Serve Others First, and Inspire Creativity. If you love serving others and would like to make a material difference in an industry-transforming organization, then we invite you to apply to this role. We are recognized as one of the Top 100 Places to Work by The Dallas Morning News, and we have been awarded as one of the fastest-growing privately held companies by SMU Cox.  Accountabilities: The Analytics engineers provide access to clean data sets to end users, modeling data in a way that empowers end users to answer their own questions. The Analytics Engineer act as a bridge between the producers and the consumers of the data  Role and Responsibilities: Taking the data compiled by the data engineer and cleaning it so that it complies with data hygiene best practices Organizing and transforming the data in a meaningful way and providing additional context as necessary so that it is ready for analysis Working with the data engineer to streamline the processes outlined above so that data is cleaner earlier in the process Maintain documentation related to datasets and analysis and ensure that everyone on the data team uses the same language and definitions. Aiding in the development and design of analytics projects as necessary Discovering opportunities for an organization to improve its systems, enterprises, and processes through the use of data analytics Working with the organization’s technology team to build and maintain complex databases Creating integrated views of data collected from multiple sources Developing and using tools, algorithms, and processes for data mining and data visualization to generate reports to be used in decision making Training other members of the organization (business analysts, key stakeholders) as necessary so that they are capable of using various data tools Minimum Qualifications and Requirements: Positive and solution-oriented mindset Comfort working in a highly agile, intensely iterative environment Self-motivated and self-managing, with task organizational skills Great communication: Regularly achieve consensus amongst technical and business teams Demonstrated capacity to communicate complex business activities, technical requirements, and recommendations clearly and concisely Extensive experience in health care and pharmaceutical industry Demonstrated experience with one or more of the following business subject areas: marketing, finance, sales, product, customer success, customer support, engineering, or people 6+ years in the Data space as an analyst, engineer, scientist, or equivalent 4+ years’ experience designing, implementing, operating, and extending commercial Kimball enterprise dimensional models 4+ years working with a large-scale Data Warehouse in a cloud environment 2+ years’ experience building reports and dashboards in a data visualization tool 1+ years creating project plans to identify tasks, milestones, and deliverables Demonstrated experience leading 4 or more analytics projects from beginning to operationalization Demonstrated experience designing and socializing Entity Relationship Diagrams and reference SQL scripts to scale data acumen and adoption Experience working with multiple cloud data warehouses, ETL tools, and data visualization technologies Bilingual in Spanish and English  Preferred Experience: Experience in AWS (Amazon Web Services), Snowflake, Taland, Tableau, Qlik

En emBlue, queremos seguir creciendo nuestra plataforma, ayudamos a las empresas a comunicarse de forma única con cientos de miles de usuarios por mes. Estamos buscando alguien capaz de liderar un equipo nuevo en la organización, por lo cual buscamos experiencia comprobable y muchas ganas de llevar este proyecto adelante. Buscamos a un QA Automation Lead Engineer que nos ayude a realizar pruebas automatizadas para nuestra plataforma. En este rol, vas a ser responsable de analizar la funcionalidad de nuestras aplicaciones y diseñar tests automatizados para validar su correcto funcionamiento en cada deployment, trabajando en conjunto con el equipo de producto, y escalando este equipo en la medida que el proyecto siga creciendo.¿Cuáles van a ser tus responsabilidades?Gestionar equipos y asignar tareas.Desarrollar pruebas automatizadas que permitan evitar regresiones en las funcionalidades de la plataforma.Mantener y mejorar dichas pruebas para maximizar su confiabilidad.Colaborar con los equipos de producto para ayudarlos a identificar los errores cuando las pruebas fallen.Realizar testing manual de las nuevas funcionalidades en caso de ser necesario, priorizando siempre la automatización.Trabajar en equipo con los diferentes sectores del área de tecnología para ayudarlos a implementar testing en sus ambientes. Requisitos¿Qué esperamos de vos?Experiencia comprobable como QA, implementando código para realizar pruebas end to end.Frameworks de testing como Cypress.Experiencia en Git.Conocimientos de TDD/BDD.Confección de casos de prueba e implementación. Conocimientos de Programación Orientada a Objetos, protocolo HTTP(s).Inglés Avanzado (excluyente)DeseableExperiencia con CI/CD.Experiencia con Cucumber.Experiencia en Javascript. Beneficios¿Qué vas a encontrar en emBlue?Cobertura médica porque nos importa tu salud.Plataforma digital de idiomas, para que estudies inglés o portugués a elección (Nulinga).Día libre en el mes de tu cumpleaños. Divertida!!Club Deportivo Corporativo.15 días de licencia para persona no gestante o adoptante.Más días de estudio porque nos importa tu desarrollo personal.Compensación por gastos de conectividad. FlexTime y Home Office porque confiamos en tu compromiso y responsabilidad con los objetivos.Programa emBlueSity para alimentar tu conocimiento.Plan de referidos.Semana emBlue.Nos gusta la agilidad, la creatividad y aplaudimos el cambio. Somos líderes en cada tarea que emprendemos. Nos ayudamos, somos humanos, estamos en esos pequeños detalles que marcan una diferencia. Buscamos ir más allá y nos vinculamos generando conversaciones personales y relevantes. Ese es el espíritu emBluer que nos identifica.Contamos con más de 18 años de experiencia en el mercado y estamos presentes en más de 15 países. Tenemos oficinas en Argentina, Brasil, Colombia, Chile, Ecuador, México, Perú y Paraguay.Nuestro propósito es ayudar a las marcas a alcanzar la omnicanalidad de manera simple, para que puedan generar conversaciones personales y relevantes con sus clientes a través de nuestra plataforma. Más de 4.500 compañías de la región y de todas las industrias usan emBlue para gestionar sus campañas de marketing automation y realizan sus envíos de email, sms y push notification. Sumate a emBlue!

control Work with key stakeholders across the business to develop and manage key master data business processes, ensuring that we collect and maintain accurate information Develop and own process for products/pipelines that are easily maintainable and reusable Design and build an infrastructure for extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a wide range of data sources  Minimum We are growing fast as a team so that's why we are currently looking for a Mid Data Engineer allocated in Latam willing to accept challenges and with a good level of communication skills. The candidate must have the ability to speak English fluently.Responsibilities for Data Engineer: Create and maintain optimal data pipeline architecture Assemble large, complex data sets that meet functional / non-functional business requirements.  Identify, design, and implement internal process improvements: automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability, etc.  Build the infrastructure required for optimal extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources using SQL and AWS 'big data' technologies.  Build analytics tools that utilize the data pipeline to provide actionable insights into customer acquisition, operational efficiency and other key business performance metrics.  Work with stakeholders across the organization to assist with data-related technical issues and support their data infrastructure needs.  Create data tools for analytics and data scientist team members that assist them in building and optimizing our product into an innovative industry leader.  Work with data and analytics experts to strive for greater functionality in our data systems. Qualifications for Data Engineer: Advanced working SQL knowledge and experience working with relational databases, query authoring (SQL) as well as working familiarity with a variety of databases.  Experience building and optimizing 'big data' data pipelines, architectures and data sets.  Experience performing root cause analysis on internal and external data and processes to answer specific business questions and identify opportunities for improvement.  Strong analytic skills related to working with unstructured datasets.  Build processes supporting data transformation, data structures, metadata, dependency and workload management.  A successful history of manipulating, processing and extracting value from large disconnected datasets.  Working knowledge of message queuing, stream processing, and highly scalable 'big data' data stores.  Strong project management and organizational skills.  Experience supporting and working with cross-functional teams in a dynamic environment.  3+ years of experience in a Data Engineer role.  Experience in: GraphQL, Postgres, Azure EDW: Azure Data Factory, SQL Server, PowerBI,Tableau or AWS Quicksight, Excel/Google Sheets, Metabase, Redshift, AWS DMS. Nice to have skills, but not strictly necessary: Salesforce.  JavaScript.  Streaming/event-based tech experience: Kafka, AWS SQS, etc.  Geospatial experience, such as PostGIS (for Postgres). Laboral Benefits: Work from Home, Insurance policy, Trainings, English classes, Great work environment, Career Path, Multicultural work, Flexible schedules, Wellness programs, Birthday day off, Christmas eve and more.About us: We are a global company that provides innovation services and software engineering solutions. En Telefónica-Movistar, tenemos como misión hacer nuestro mundo más humano, conectando la vida de las personas, entendemos que son ustedes quienes le dan sentido a la tecnología y no al revés. Sabemos que las conexiones más importantes son las humanas, por eso hemos puesto en marcha un nuevo modelo operativo multi país para maximizar el valor de nuestros activos y el talento de nuestros colaboradores, unificando las operaciones de Argentina, Chile, Colombia, Ecuador, México, Perú, Uruguay y Venezuela, para formar Telefónica Hispanoamérica; unimos a las personas en lugar de aislarlas y las invitamos a ser ellas mismas, a expresarse, a compartir.  MISION DEL ROL: En el marco de la nueva estructura de HISPAM, que aglutina los activos y operaciones en Argentina, Chile, Colombia, Ecuador, Perú, México, Uruguay y Venezuela, se hace necesario un Especialista de Planificación y Diseño Conectividad IP que se encargue del diseño de las redes IP.La función considera todo lo relacionado con la planificación, análisis, diseño y definición de arquitecturas multi-pais para brindar la conectividad IP en los accesos y el backbone para los servicios Fijo, Movil y Corporativo (B2B), como asi también la conectividad con Internet (salidas internacionales, peering y cache) y con las plataformas Fijas/Movil en los Datacenters. Adicionalmente debe participar activamente en la definición del roadmap evolutivo de las tecnologías que soportan la infraestructura de esta sección de la red, construir el diseño para armar el presupuesto de inversión en cada uno de los países y desarrollar los procesos de compra incluidos en los marcos inversores que se realizan como planes de expansión de las diferentes redes.  FUNCIONES: 1. Analizar la estrategia y evolución de las redes de los diferentes países. Interactuar con proveedores tecnológicos y áreas transversales de las diferentes operaciones de HISPAM. 2. Efectuar análisis sobre las demandas de las diferentes OB para llevarlos a los planes de despliegue y expansión de las redes de los diferentes países.  3. Diseño de las redes IP multiservicio para brindar conectividad al tráfico Fijo, Móvil y Corporativo (B2B) de cada una de las redes de HISPAM, incluyendo su evolución, expansión y simplificación de redes actuales y legadas. 4. Aportar con estrategias que permitan obtener eficiencias económicas alineadas con el marco tecnológico definido para cada una de las operaciones. 5. Colaborar con la mesa de compras de manera técnica en las negociaciones para las compras requeridas por las diferentes OBs. 6. Construcción de HLD para las estrategias de crecimiento de las diferentes redes de cada uno de los países. 7. Estar actualizado de los mercados fijos y móviles de cada país, que ayude a la toma de decisiones en relación a estrategias de expansión de las redes. 8. Monitoreo de Capacidad de Red, Evolución del Tráfico y Forecast de Crecimiento para el correcto Capacity Planning (Sizing). 10. Generación de planes estratégicos en base a las necesidades de diseño de redes, identificando las necesidades de CAPex/OPex incluyendo el TCO. Requisitos IndispensablesIngeniero en Telecomunicaciones o Ingeniero Eléctrico o Electrónico con especialización en Telecomunicaciones.Requisitos DeseablesMínimo 5 años en Planificación y/o Implementación de Redes IP, Datacenters para soportar servicios Fijos y móviles.COMPETENCIAS:· Conocimientos de Networking Routing & Switching (MPLS (LDP & RSVP), VPNL3, VPNL2, Multicast, BGP, OSPF, ISIS, Segment Routing, VXLAN, EVPN. · Conocimiento en mecanismos de transición de IPv4 a IPv6. · Conocimiento en SDN, NFV, SD-WAN, Spine & Leaf · Conocimientos generales de tecnologías SDN, API y protocolos NETCONF, RESTCONF, gRPC  · Conocimientos generales de arquitecturas de redes Fijas (xDSL, GPON/FTTH), Móviles (UMTS, LTE 5G), Mobile Core Network, VNFs/CNFs y de Transporte (DWDM, SDH) · Conocimiento de Metodología de Gestión de Proyectos: Waterfall, Agile (LEAN, Scrum, KANBAN). · Conocimientos básicos de señalización y acceso de redes móviles. · Conocimiento básico de Data Science & Data Analytics (PowerBI); · Excelentes habilidades de Comunicación para el liderazgo de proyectos, trabajo en equipo, presentaciones efectivas ante audiencias, presenciales y virtuales; y manejo de situaciones conflictivas. · Inglés técnico Intermedio.

The Department of Computer Science and Mathematics in the School of Arts and Sciences at the Lebanese American University invites applicants for a tenure-track faculty position at the rank of Assistant/Associate Professor in the field of Bioinformatics. The department is seeking highly qualified and motivated faculty members who are committed to research, innovative teaching, program development, academic advising, and institutional service.QualificationsProspective candidates must have earned a PhD in Bioinformatics, Computational Biology or a related discipline from a well-recognized University and have an excellent publication record with evidence of success in securing external funding for research. Experience in evolutionary and functional genomics, data science, and strong programming skills in scripted languages is required.ResponsibilitiesTeach undergraduate and graduate Bioinformatics Science coursesEngage in scholarly work and researchAdvise and mentor studentsSupervise capstone projects and MSc Thesis studentsEngage in service to the department, the university and the professionContribute to the development of the program and seek external grantsAdditional duties may be set by the department in light of departmental needs and prioritiesThe DepartmentTheDepartment of Computer Science & Mathematicsis one of the five departments of theSchool of Arts and Sciences at LAU. It offers a Bachelor of Science (B.S.) in Computer Science, a B.S. in Bioinformatics, a B.S. in Mathematics, a Master of Science (M.S.) in Applied and Computational Mathematics and an M.S. in Computer Science.The UniversityLAU has two campuses, one in Beirut and the other in Byblos, about 35 kilometers north of Beirut. LAU is an Equal Opportunity Employer operating in Lebanon under a charter from the Regents of the State University of New York, and is accredited by theNew England Commission on Higher Education, Inc. (NECHE) .Application RequirementsProspective candidates should apply electronically by sending a letter of interest including a statement of teaching, research interests, an updated CV, and transcripts by email to:****** . The CV should include the names, e-mails and phone numbers of three references. The university reserves the right to contact additional references with notice given to the candidates at an appropriate time in the process.Candidates must refer to position no. AS-24-5, in the su bject line of the email.

Nos encontramos en la búsqueda de un "Ingeniero de Datos Azure", para nuestra línea de negocio.RequisitosDeseable certificación en Azure Data Engineering (AZ-900, DP-900, DP-300, DP-203).Experiencia mínima de 2 años usando Azure DB SQL, Azure Data Lake Storage, Azure Data Factory y Azure Databricks.Deseable la generación de tableros de gestión con Power BI.Experiencia con especificaciones técnicas para extracción de datos, código de buena calidad con performance aceptables.Experiencia en la construcción de ETL con trabajos por lotes, programación y procesamiento de datos.Experiencia en el análisis de datos utilizando SQL, analizando datos redundantes e inconsistentes, diagramando flujos de datos y flujos de procesos.Experiencia en servicios de datos, tareas de limpieza y transformaciones de calidad de datos, como la estandarización, limpieza, fusión, eliminación de duplicados.Experiencia en la creación de scripts y funciones.Orientado a procesos, la comprensión del desarrollo de software y mejores prácticas de ETL.Conocimiento sólido de lenguajes SQL, Python o Scala, y servicios en Cloud Computing y Big Data.Deseable conocimiento de los datos maestros y datos transaccionales en procesos comerciales, de preferencia en SAP Business Suite ERP.Comprende los patrones de arquitectura de datos.Buena comunicación verbal para explicar soluciones complejas a los clientes de manera clara y concisa. Debe interactuar con los equipos empresariales y de TI.Deseable inglés avanzado.FuncionesAnálisis, diseño, desarrollo de procesamiento de datos, soporte, mantenimiento y documentación de desarrollos en soluciones de integración con Azure.Diseño e implementación de la seguridad de datos.Uso de las mejores prácticas (herramientas y técnicas) durante el diseño y desarrollo.Monitoreo y optimización del almacenamiento y procesamiento de datos.Programación de batch jobs y resolución de problemas (validar, rastrear y debug de jobs).Trabajo con analistas de negocios y equipos técnicos de sistemas (líder, PMO, analistas y arquitecto) para el desarrollo de la nueva solución.Plan y resultado de pruebas unitarias.Transferencia técnica a TI.¡Ven y únete a la familia CSTI CORP!CSTI Corp es una empresa peruana líder en la industria TI con más de 13 años en el mercado en países como Perú, Ecuador, Colombia, Costa Rica y Estados Unidos. Ofrece soluciones de negocios en las líneas de Outsourcing, Licenciamientos SAP y Microsoft, soporte y mejora de aplicaciones, así como implementación y migración de sistemas bajo estrategias Cloud, aprovechando su alianza con marcas como Amazon, Azure, Huawei Cloud y Google Cloud.

Upwork ($UPWK) is the world’s work marketplace. We serve everyone from one-person startups to over 30% of the Fortune 100 with a powerful, trust-driven platform that enables companies and talent to work together in new ways that unlock their potential.Last year, more than $3.3 billion of work was done through Upwork by skilled professionals who are gaining more control by finding work they are passionate about and innovating their careers.This is an engagement through Upwork’s Hybrid Workforce Solutions (HWS) Team. Our Hybrid Workforce Solutions Team is a global group of professionals that support Upwork’s business. Our HWS team members are located all over the world.Work/Project Scope:Data Infrastructure team at Upwork is the center of engineering excellence for best practices relating to provisioning, maintenance, right-scaling, cost-effective use, use-appropriate targeting of many types of stateful storage technologies: transactional databases, document databases, cache/key-value stores, streaming data stores etc.Senior Data Infrastructure Engineer with DI team is a hyper-collaborative data infrastructure domain expert with a strong desire (and skills) to automate.As Data Infrastructure Domain Expert you will:Ensure that the Data Infrastructure team has a ready-to-apply library of best-in-class homework, templates and decision tree that matches data usage patterns with data storage technology tech that is most effective in addressing needs of feature development teams.Keep technology vendor portfolio fresh through periodic data storage technology vendor scans, research, qualification and rating.Drive excellence in engineering workflows, process design, technology choices supporting data storage lifecycle events like version upgrades, proactive right-scaling, predictive issue pattern formulation and automation supporting preemption of unplanned outages.Design scale-appropriate data infrastructure governance process and automations that allow transparent, zero-downtime background servicing of hundreds of systems concurrently. Proactively eliminate manual servicing requirements through design of resilient data infrastructure systems and process automation.Author self-service best practices for data consumption, performance monitoring tools and workflows. Proactively advocate adaption of these by feature development teams.In collaboration with Data Science, Data Processing teams innovate data storage systems interfaces in support for ETL, data transformation and data quality systems with eye on low maintenance costs, low latency, higher throughput, simplicity of use.Be the domain expert for a set of storage technologies, including intimate understanding of query expression language/APIs, tuning, scaling, horizontal resiliency options.As Collaborative Solutions Innovator you will:Constantly gather input from feature development teams using our data infrastructure, identify developer experience improvement opportunities, design systems that prevent data infrastructure related incidents, guide feature teams towards safe systems use.Collaborate directly with "storage" teams of various cloud providers (AWS, GCP) in driving combined innovation and engineering standard methodologies. Help design, drive, coordinate case studies targeting improvements in design and use of vendored data storage systems.Integrate components and input from core infrastructure, information security and other internal "building blocks" teams in constructing data storage solutions.Participate in multi-department risk assessment exercises and design systemic mitigating solutions pertaining to data infrastructure security, disaster recoverability, business continuity.As Process Automation Specialist you will:Discover, pursue, document ineffective manual processes relating to the lifecycle of Data Infrastructure maintenance and use. Propose, implement process automation, using corporate workflow automation platforms, decision capture workflows.Individually create services, expose internal APIs for these services that allow other teams, workflows leverage data infrastructure automation components.Design multi-department process workflows and integrations supporting data infrastructure lifecycle. Manage delivery dependencies outsourced to other teams.Participate in on-call, incidence mitigation sessions. Capture experiences related to manual activities and convert them into automation primitives supporting self-service use by feature development, SRE, data-consuming teams.Must Haves (Required Skills):Demonstrable expertise (deployment, use) in some of the following data storage technologies: Postgres/MySQL (“on-prem”, RDS, Aurora), Kafka / Kinesis (“on-prem” or managed), ElasticSearch/OpenSearch/Mongo, Redis/Memcache, analytical databases like Snowflake/Clickhouse/Greenplum, data federation engines like Presto/Trino/Dremio/Athena.Demonstrable prior experience with Terraform for managing cloud infrastructure. Kubernetes, CloudFormation, Hashicorp Packer, Chef/Ansible knowledge are huge pluses.Demonstrable familiarity with engineering workflow automation tools like ArgoCD/Workflow, AirFlow, Jenkins.Strong scripting experience with Python (preferred), shell (secondary).Significant prior exposure to cloud vendors AWS (preferred), GCP, Azure. Demonstrable knowledge of specifics of resource creation and policy (permissions) management in cloud environments.Persistent drive to learn new things and deepen your expertise.You are a natural fit if:You have done projects like these before and are looking for a friendly, meritocratic, engineering-excellence-focused environment to call home.You are an established, modern DevOps/IT engineer hoping to specialize in data and resilient stateful storage systems.You are a seasoned DBA with a strong drive to build your infrastructure provisioning core competencies.You are an empathetic SRE or sales/solutions engineer hoping to enhance your domain specialist value in data space.You are a seasoned data engineer deliberately shifting your professional definition from daily grind of ETL to systemic fundamentals of stateful storage resiliency and infrastructure lifecycles.Upwork is proudly committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive workforce. We never discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical condition), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.#LD-L1To learn more about how Upwork processes and protects your personal information as part of the application process, please review our Global Job Applicant Privacy Notice

Job OverviewLead Data Management Department to efficiently produce databases that meet customer requirements and company financial objectives.Essential Functions Manage a Data Management Department, which could be either all data management staff at an office or a subset of staff (80-120) within a large Data Management office. Consolidate resource requirements and define staffing needs that ensure project objectives can be met while maximizing utilization, realization and minimizing costs. Monitor and manage utilization and productivity. Ensure performance of staff is regularly assessed and documented. Define staffing needs based on hard backlog and strategic plan for office. Define and implement department objectives consistent with broader office and regional objectives. Provide technical advice and solutions to solve problems and improve efficiency across functions, projects and customers. Monitor quality and efficiency across projects to identify trends and opportunities for improvements. Ensure sharing of learning across projects and departments. Participate in defining strategies for new processes and technology at either regional or global level. Ensure that staff is trained and compliant with current operating procedures and work instructions and project scope of work. Work with peers within office and regions to define and implement training strategies. Mentor staff members to develop Data Management, drug development and business expertise. Manage relationship with customer functional peers. Provide operational input into proposals for large programs and strategic partnerships. Provide input to costing algorithms and standard proposal text. Attend customer meetings and lead discussions of project requirements and strategic planning. Recommend placement of projects based on staffing levels and hard backlog, technology requirements and customer relationships. Ensure compliance of work with project’s scope of work. Actively assess and manage project realization. Ensure project milestones are met according to agreed upon timelines with high quality. May serve as a Data Management Customer Liaison for one or more customers. Manage staff in accordance with organization’s policies and applicable regulations. Responsibilities include planning, assigning, and directing work Appraising performance and guiding professional development Rewarding and disciplining employees Addressing employee relations issues and resolving problems. Approve actions on human resources matters.Qualifications Bachelor's Degree Or educational equivalence, in clinical, biological or mathematical sciences, or related field, or nursing qualification with 12 years of experience including global drug development, and leading a data management function. Advanced knowledge of Data Management processes and systems including new technologies. Knowledge of fundamental business processes. Outstanding written and oral communication skills. Proven leadership skills. Excellent organizational skills and demonstrated ability to delegate and monitor quality of outputs. Outstanding negotiation, decision-making and problem solving skills. Excellent interpersonal skills. Highly motivated with the ability to be creative. Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with coworkers, managers and clients.IQVIA is a leading global provider of advanced analytics, technology solutions and clinical research services to the life sciences industry. We believe in pushing the boundaries of human science and data science to make the biggest impact possible – to help our customers create a healthier world. Learn more at https://jobs.iqvia.com

Latam Marketing Automation Specialist ¿Te gustaría unirte a un equipo diverso e inclusivo? ¿Buscas impactar con tu conocimiento una empresa multinacional líder? ¡Esta oportunidad está esperando por ti!Este es un rol híbrido con la flexibilidad de trabajar tanto virtualmente como desde nuestras oficinas en Latino America.Aon está en el negocio de las mejores decisionesEn Aon, damos forma a las decisiones para mejoría para proteger y enriquecer las vidas de las personas alrededor del mundo.Como organización, estamos unidos a través de la confianza como un equipo inclusivo y diverso, y nos apasiona ayudar a nuestros colegas y clientes a tener éxito.Cómo será el día típicoEl Especialista en Automatización de Marketing será responsable de construir, ejecutar y mantener campañas de marketing alineadas con los requisitos del negocio para la generación de leads. Además, nuestro entorno ágil e inclusivo le permite gestionar su bienestar y el equilibrio entre el trabajo y la vida, lo que garantiza que pueda ser su mejor ‘yo’ en Aon. Además, todos nuestros colegas disfrutan de dos “Global Wellbeing Days” cada año, animándole a tomarse un tiempo para concentrarte en si mismo. Ofrecemos una variedad de soluciones de estilo de trabajo, pero también reconocemos que la flexibilidad va más allá del lugar de trabajo... y todos estamos a favor. ¡Lo llamamos Smart Working!Nuestra cultura de aprendizaje continuo te inspira y te equipa para aprender, compartir y crecer, ayudándole a alcanzar su máximo potencial. The Lead Integration Engineer will help our communities thrive by designing and implementing integration solutions for data from APIs/Events/Batch based systems. We are a culture that is unabashedly driven by purpose. We are making a difference to our patients and providers while growing at an accelerated rate.  Every day, we support the health journey of patients by authentically living our core values: Purpose Driven, Relationships Matter, Serve Others First, and Inspire Creativity. If you love serving others and would like to make a material difference in an industry-transforming organization, then we invite you to apply to this role. We are recognized as one of the Top 100 Places to Work by The Dallas Morning News, and we have been awarded as one of the fastest-growing privately held companies by SMU Cox. Accountabilities The Lead Integration Engineer supports various projects, identifies business needs, and proposes IT solutions to existing components and ensures that final solutions meet organizational needs. Develops and implements solutions that integrate data across the enterprise by evaluating existing components or systems to determine integration requirements and ensures that final solutions meet the organization's needs. Knowledge of the latest integration solutions and problem-solving methods using creativity, customer service, and teamwork.  Role and Responsibilities: Lead the design, development and maintenance of metadata driven data pipeline automation framework(s) for batch, event, and streaming data in cloud native environment Drive end-to-end technical planning and development integrations, from high-level architecture down to code implementation in a fast-paced, innovation-focused environment Perform deep-dive analysis to understand and solve integration needs between data sources and applications Build an integration strategy based on principles of reusability, security, scalability, and quality. Communicate across various internal and external stakeholders to understand the business goals and feasibility of proposed integrations. Collaborate and communicate with the broader Engineering and Product Teams Drive detailed project estimations, break-down, delivery, monitoring, and maintenance Embrace new technologies and work with various tools and technologies to achieve desired functionality Participate in code and architectural reviews Rapid prototyping and presenting proof of concepts for key technology decision to collaborators and other technology leaders. Build end to end data pipelines from source to target ensuring data quality, consistency and observability using DataOps principles Coach and mentor engineers Utilize IT documents, charts, and drawings as tools to enhance, document, and control integration and interface information. Lead and manage external reviews of project integration aspects. Represent the project’s integration work at project-level meetings.  Minimum Qualifications and Requirements:  Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or equivalent 7+ years of deep hands-on experience with multiple integration solutions and architectures, integration and API engineering, cloud technologies, and data modeling 3+ years of hand on experience in metadata management, metadata driven automation and developer efficiency tooling 3+ years of cloud native data solutions enabling Analytics, Operational, Data Science and ML use cases 3+ year event-driven and streaming solutions in cloud native environment 5+ years with advanced SQL and scripting (python/bash etc.) development Demonstrable track record of shipping and supporting high-performing and secure Saas web applications and 3rd party integration Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, with the ability to break down technical concepts and communicate them to an audience of varying technical expertise Strong understanding of Web Services protocols such as REST, GraphQL and API design for extensibility and portability. Hands-on cloud expertise (preferably AWS) with strong understanding of SaaS models Knowledge in engineering practices such as code refactoring, design patterns, design driven development, continuous integration, building highly scalable application and security Preferred Experience: Bilingual in Spanish and English Master's degree or higher in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or similar analytical field. Health care and pharmaceutical experience Experience working/collaborating with Master Data Management, Metadata Management and Data Governance

Ofrece soluciones de negocios en las líneas de Outsourcing, Licenciamientos SAP y Microsoft, soporte y mejora de aplicaciones, así como implementación y migración de sistemas bajo estrategias Cloud, aprovechando su alianza con marcas como Amazon, Azure, Huawei Cloud y Google Cloud.

Planificar y supervisar el análisis de los Modelos de perfil de Pagos del Cliente de Tarjetas (Pago mínimo, Pago full, Totaleros), con la finalidad de segmentar el portafolio de tarjetas de crédito para determinar el perfil de pago del cliente respecto a sus deudas asumidas. Liderar la identificación y detección de los factores de comportamiento, permanencia y fuga de clientes del banco, con la finalidad de diseñar estrategias y/o acciones que contribuyan a rentabilizar mayor tiempo al cliente y mejorar la Retención de los clientes identificando su probabilidad de fuga para realizar una retención proactiva y un valor Cliente para una retención Reactiva. Comprende la cultura de riesgo del Banco y cómo debe considerarse el apetito de riesgo en las actividades y decisiones diarias. Crea un entorno donde su equipo realiza operaciones eficaces y eficientes en sus áreas respectivas, a la vez que garantiza la idoneidad, el cumplimiento y la eficacia de los controles diarios a fin de cumplir con las obligaciones destinadas a reducir el riesgo operacional, el riesgo de incumplimiento reglamentario, el riesgo de lavado de dinero y de financiamiento al terrorismo y el riesgo de conducta, entre las que se incluyen las responsabilidades establecidas bajo el Marco de Gestión del Riesgo Operacional, el Marco de Gestión de Riesgo del Incumplimiento Reglamentario, el Manual Internacional de Prevención del Lavado de Dinero y Financiamiento al Terrorismo y las Pautas para la Conducta en los Negocios. Promueve un entorno de alto desempeño e implementa una estrategia para la fuerza laboral que atrae, retiene, desarrolla y motiva a su equipo, y para lograr esto, fomenta un entorno laboral inclusivo, comunica la visión, los valores y la estrategia de negocios y maneja un plan de sucesión y desarrollo para el equipo. ¿Qué esperamos de ti? Descripción empresa:Somos Falabella, UN equipo diverso con más de 100 mil colaboradores compuesto por grandes marcas: Falabella Retail, Sodimac, Banco Falabella, Seguros Falabella, Tottus, Mallplaza, Open Plaza y Linio. Hoy tenemos presencia en 7 países de América Latina, además de oficinas en China e India.Cada día es diferente, trabajamos en equipo, con compromiso, buscando siempre superar las expectativas de nuestros clientes. Si eres una persona que se apasiona por el trabajo dinámico y el desafío constante ¡Esta es tu oportunidad de hacer que las cosas pasen!Misión del cargo:Construir arquitecturas robustas y escalables en la nube de Google que soporten las necesidades de negocio de data y analytics.Funciones del cargo:¡Si tienes una mente inquieta y te gusta soñar en grande, este llamado es para ti!En Tottus Perú buscamos un Senior Data Architect para sumarse al equipo de Gerencia de Transformación y Eficiencia del Negocio.Somos Falabella, UN equipo diverso con más de 100 mil colaboradores compuesto por grandes marcas: Falabella Retail, Sodimac, Banco Falabella, Seguros Falabella, Tottus, Mallplaza, Open Plaza y Linio. Hoy tenemos presencia en 7 países de America Latina, además de oficinas en China e India. Cada día es diferente, trabajamos en equipo, con compromiso, buscando siempre superar las expectativas de nuestros clientes. Si eres una persona que se apasiona por el trabajo dinámico y el desafío constante ¡Esta es tu oportunidad de hacer que las cosas pasen!El desafío principal del cargo es construir arquitecturas robustas y escalables en la nube de Google que soporten las necesidades de negocio de data y analytics.Tus principales funciones serán:- Diseñar, desarrollar y probar herramientas y frameworks (arquitecturas) para mejorar la productividad de los equipos de Data Science definiendo enviroments (Dev, QA, UAT, Prod) asociados a code repositories (Gitlab, Github, bitbucket) que faciliten el DevOps y MLOps en los distintos workflows sobre la arquitectura- Implementar procesos automáticos E2E sobre arquitecturas escalables que faciliten la creación de workflows identificando cada fase de un modelo ML(Data Inputs, Data Pre-Processing, Transformation, Feature Engineering, Training, Test and Inference)- Medir y garantizar la continua calibración y calidad de los modelos productivizados incorporando KPIs y métricas automatizadas (Precision, Recalls, AUROC curve, etc) - Escriba, pruebe y documente código de alta calidad para crear nuevas métodos y librerías reutilizables para los equipos en escenarios de Infrastructure as a Code (IaC) con herramientas como Terraform, CloudDeployment permitiendo la automatización de infraestructura sobre la nube de GCP.- Investigar las tendencias en arquitectura y machine learning que nos permitan adoptarlas de manera temprana.Requisitos:Experiencia mínima de 5 años como Ingeniero de Datos en proyectos de Big Data-Experiencia mínima de 3 años en Arquitectura de Datos-Experiencia mínima de 3 años en la nube, de preferencia en GCP-Experiencia trabajando bajo un modelo operativo ágil.-Deseable: Certificación en GCP - Upwork ($UPWK) is the world’s work marketplace. configure and maintain security infrastructure for corporate and cloud environmentsPartner with Global Security to constantly improve the company's network security standardsParticipate in cloud infrastructure security standards, including security, configurations in the public cloud (Azure, AWS, etc.) platforms  Develop automated methods to remediate and mitigate network events and minimize network operational complexity  Handle complex and detailed hands-on technical projects to establish and maintain a secure environment  Implement and maintain network security infrastructure globally including Firewalls, DDOS mitigation, VPN, and remote access  Design, build, and deployment of solutions that protect the company and its customers against advanced threats  Research and understand emerging information security threats, vulnerabilities, detection, and remediation to secure the network environments  Potential travel to support field office projects Requirements:  5+ years of network engineering experience, supporting large global multi-vendor enterprise infrastructure  Demonstrable experience in building distributed security systems and highly available services  Proficient in network-security concepts such as firewall, network segmentation, proxies, and IPS/IDS  Solid knowledge in routing and switching technologies and protocols: BGP, OSPF, EIGRP, VTP, VRF, STP, VLAN, vPC, HSRP, VRRP, MPLS, QoS, GRE, IP SEC, DNS, TACACS, NTP, etc.  Knowledge of identity and access concepts and technologies to secure production and corporate access, such as SSO and SAML Lead implementation and configuration of security solutions, working with vendors and professional services as needed  Review solution architecture and lead security solution implementations and associated configurations  Experience running and maintaining a 24x7 Internet-facing production environment, across multiple data centers including public clouds  Experience with Palo Alto Networks including Panorama required  Experience using network diagnosis and packet analysis tools  Strong verbal and written interpersonal and communication skills  Ability to work independently and solve problems with speed and efficiency  Ability to self-motivate and manage/prioritize tasks  Passion for customer service and attention to detail and accuracy Education:  Bachelor’s degree in computer
